content: a hat for liam conejo this is an *untested* pattern it will be updated as feedback comes in - please email any notes to askpurlanything@gmail com the photo shows a double-sided hat which appears to be a k1p1 rib as it s uniform on both sides i will make much more nuanced notes later but i think this should result in a pretty reasonable facsimile on a personal note i completely understand the desire to engage in politically motivated knits - we are fiber artists it s often the first way we think of to respond to outside forces and having projects like these on our needles helps to quell some of the helplessness in our hearts but please remember a hat is not a replacement for leaning into the real work of resistance knit away but please also make sure you are engaging in other ways too let your hats be a way to keep your hands busy don t let them become an act of performative feel-good action many of you will recall the call-outs from black women in particular around the pussy hat craze if not it s worth reading up on some things that were said excellent points were made many times over any search engine will help locate a few good examples the current wave of protest hats is inspired by hats rumored to have been worn by norwegians as an act of resistance in wwii a knit accessory born out of action and rebellion let us follow that example and wear these hats with fortitude and in solidarity as we take action supplies size 7 4 5 mm 16 circular needles size 7 4 5 mm dpns worsted weight yarn amount tbd main color mc blue amount tbd contrast color cc while amount tbd stitch markers gauge tbd sizes toddler child adult fits heads 14-18 16-20 18-22 instructions cast on 80 96 112 stitches long tail tubular cast on will produce a look closest to the picture but do what you re most comfortable with join to work in the round being careful not to twist round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat round 1 until piece measures approximately 7 7 ¾ 8 ¼ from cast-on edge decreases change to dpns when necessary round 1 *k 10 12 14 pm repeat from * to end of round round 2 *k 8 10 12 k2tog slip marker repeat from * to end of round round 3 k all stitches round 4 *k until 2 sts before marker k2tog slip marker repeat from * to end of round repeat rounds 3 and 4 until 16 stitches remain final round *k2tog repeat from * to end of round cut tail and thread through remaining stitches then bring tail inside hat and weave in ears with white yarn and size 7 dpns cast on 8 10 12 stitches join to work in the round being careful not to twist row 1 -
